website_summaries.verdict: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ1000 is a formidable still and video camera thanks to a big 1-inch sensor and 4K recording capability.
pros: Superior image quality at higher ISOs
cons: 4K video is cropped and requires manual exposure control

customer_reviews.title: Questinable stll Image Clarity
customer_reviews.text: I have just returned this camera having found still images produced to be soft focussed regardless of whether produced with JPEG or RAW. I am an experienced photographer & understand how the camera should be set up. Video was good but my assumption is that either this camera was faulty , or as indicated in some professional review sites, there may be a problem with the lens arrangement. I have subsequently purchased the Panasonic FZ 1000 which produces excellent still images & video whilst being cheaper & lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Great all rounder camera. Get rid of the lenses and take this with you. It's big, sure but if you want a great all-rounder to carry around with you. This has to be in the top 3 to choose from.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Richards

customer_reviews.title: Good , but with limitations
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these. They are a joy to use. The main let downs are : 1. contast detection autofocus isn't good - in fact , just use manual and save yourself a headache. 2. the lens is mediocre , but adequate. 3...VLog-L is extra purchase - I wouldn't bother , bought it , never use it. Big positive : 1. can send 4:2:2 10 bit to external recorder , like Atomos 2. good stabiliser 3. loads of features
customer_reviews.author: Martian Invader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: As I was going to visit Kennedy Space Centre I thought I'd treat myself to a new bridge camera as my existing Pentax DSLR would be a bit heavy to carry around. I already had a lower end Lumix FZ camera which was pretty good so I went for Panasonic's top of the range model. It didn't disappoint. It is easy(ish) to use and the picture quality is very good. It has a lot of features - I'm looking forward to trying it's time lapse feature.
customer_reviews.author: mgibbs

customer_reviews.title: ALL FEATURES WORK WELL
customer_reviews.text: ALL OPTIONS WORK WELL BUT YOU HAVE TO SPEND TIME GETTING TO KNOW YOUR WAY ROUND THE VARIOUS MENUS
customer_reviews.author: Brian Martin

customer_reviews.title: Video is great
customer_reviews.text: Good for video, but stills don't compare to a DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: thor

customer_reviews.title: The best Bridge Camera for 4k Video to date.
customer_reviews.text: Having owned over 10 Panasonic Lumix cameras from Compacts, Bridge and Micro Four Third systems this upgrade to the FZ1000 ticks all the boxes. A lot more features for the serious videographer such as the built in ND filter system, colour bars, master pedestal and Cinelike D & V profiles. 4K video is superb and even if you downscale to 1080p it gives you flexibility to crop into a shot and get higher resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin's Tech Cave

customer_reviews.title: An excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are much better than my previous (much cheaper) bridge camera. It was worth paying the extra money for this.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: When I inserted the battery into the brand new camera ...
customer_reviews.text: When I inserted the battery into the brand new camera and switched on, the warning flashed "SYSTEM ERROR (OIS). The camera also switched itself off. Knowing that it was faulty, I returned it to Amazon. As always, Amazon was quick to refund my money!
customer_reviews.author: AMUL

customer_reviews.title: WiFi will not transfer videos
customer_reviews.text: Great pictures and videos. But cannot transfer videos via WiFi. Panasonic unable to provide a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer
